Detailed Description

Store information about a Tapi-compliant device, necessary e.g. for the core (tapi_core) or the gui (tapi_gui)

Author
Tobias Holst
Version
2.1.1

Tapi::Device::Device ( uint8_t  type,
std::string  name,
std::string  uuid,
unsigned long  lastSeq,
ros::Time  lastSeen,
unsigned long  heartbeat,
std::map< std::string, Feature >  features 
)

Create a Device object.

Parameters
typeType of the device (tapi_lib::Device::Type_Publisher for Publisher and ServiceServer or tapi_lib::Device::Type_Subscriber for Subscriber and ServiceClients)
nameName of the device
uuidUnique ID of the device
lastSeqSequence number of the header of the device when it has been seen for the last time
lastSeenTimestamp when the device has been seen for the last time
heartbeatHeartbeat (delay the device shall wait between two Hello-calls) configured for this device
featuresMap of Tapi::Feature objects to describe the features of the device
See also

Member Function Documentation

bool Tapi::Device::Active ( )

Get the state of the device.

Returns
true if the device is active, false if the device is inactive (hasn't connected to hello service for a longer time)
See also
Tapi::Device::active

Definition at line 64 of file device.cpp.

bool Tapi::Device::compareFeatureNames ( const Feature *  first,
const Feature *  second 
)
staticprivate

To sort Feature there has to be a compare function, comparing their names.

Parameters
firstPointer to the first Feature to compare
secondPointer to the second Feature to compare
Returns
true if the first Feature's name has to be above the second's Feature name in an alphabetically sort, false when it's vice versa
See also
Tapi::Feature
